alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 18 at 9:03PM MST until November 20 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM SUNDAY TO 11 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 10 inches. Locally higher amounts possible on the northeast facing slopes of the southern Sangre De Cristo mountains. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Feet, Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Above 7500 Feet and Wet Mountains Above 10000 Feet. * WHEN...From 5 PM Sunday to 11 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility over the mountain passes. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
